macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 Falls for Three Consecutive Days, Briefly Below 50-Day Moving Average
items.summary: The stock market has declined for the last three days, with the S&P 500 briefly dipping below its 50-day moving average amid a shift to conservative sectors like consumer staples and industrials. Wall Street adopts a more cautious outlook following Fed rate cuts, with tech underperforming.

items.title: Fed Cuts Interest Rates, Boosting S&P 500 to New All-Time High Above 6,900
items.summary: Last Wednesday, the Fed voted to cut interest rates, leading to an S&P 500 rally to a new all-time high above 6,900 on Thursday, up nearly 40% from April lows. Lower rates favor stable dividend stocks, with Dow Industrials outpacing S&P recently.

items.title: Russell 2000 Hits New High, Outpacing S&P 500 in Rotation to Small-Caps
items.summary: The Russell 2000 small-cap index reached a new high, outperforming the S&P 500 over the last month amid predictions of sector rotation. This follows a five-year lag for small-caps.

items.title: Qualcomm Stock Surges 12% on New AI Chips AI200 and AI250 Announcement
items.summary: Qualcomm unveiled AI200 and AI250 chips for the AI data center market, securing first customer HUMAIN and competing with Nvidia. Strong profits and cost management drive optimism despite mixed numbers.

items.title: Dow Jones Reverses from 49,000 Resistance, Targets 47,525 Support
items.summary: On December 17, 2025, Dow Jones reversed from 49,000 resistance level and is likely to fall to 47,525 support per wave analysis.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs Record Large Outflows
items.summary: U.S. Bitcoin spot ETFs saw net outflows of about $158.3M while Ethereum spot ETFs experienced roughly $75.9M in withdrawals on Dec. 19, reflecting short-term fund flow volatility in institutional products and concentrated redemptions from specific funds such as IBIT and BlackRock’s ETHA.

items.title: BlackRock Moves ~36,579 ETH to Coinbase; Whale Selling Flags Risk Near $3,000
items.summary: On-chain trackers reported BlackRock deposited 36,579 ETH (≈$108.4M) into Coinbase over 24 hours, while other large transfers (including Arthur Hayes moving 680 ETH to Binance) have raised concerns about potential selling pressure as Ethereum trades near the $2,900–$3,000 range.

items.title: Weekly market summary: Bitcoin weakness and Ethereum relative strength; altcoins deeply lagging
items.summary: A weekly market note highlights Bitcoin weakening with on-chain warning signs (flows back to exchanges) while Ethereum shows pockets of strength; many altcoins have been hit harder—some down over 50%—though select tokens (e.g., Monero) showed outperformance, suggesting possible altcoin relief if BTC stabilizes.

items.title: Analysis: Bitcoin faces risk of pullback despite ongoing whale accumulation
items.summary: Market commentary outlines two near-term paths for Bitcoin — a possible corrective drop toward the low $70K area before resuming a run to higher targets — while noting continued whale accumulation and mixed technical signals that imply elevated short-term volatility.

items.title: Crypto market turmoil hits hedge funds in a difficult year
items.summary: Coverage reports that rapid, liquidity-thin price moves in crypto this year have contributed to significant losses and operational stress for hedge funds, marking one of their worst years since the 2022 crash.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: China Builds Prototype AI Chip Amid US Restrictions
items.summary: Chinese scientists in Shenzhen have developed a prototype machine for producing cutting-edge semiconductor chips powering AI, smartphones, and weapons, countering US efforts to limit access.

items.title: Meta Adopts Alibaba's Qwen AI for Training New Model
items.summary: Meta is reportedly using Alibaba's Qwen model to train a new AI model code-named Avocado, signaling growing integration of Chinese AI technologies in Western companies.
items.source: CTO at NCSC Summary / South China Morning Post

items.title: Trump Administration Announces National AI Policy Framework
items.summary: President Trump directs the Attorney General to form an AI Litigation Task Force to challenge unlawful state AI laws harming innovation, establishing a national policy framework.
items.source: CTO at NCSC Summary / The White House

items.title: New Research Reveals Inductive Backdoors and Memory Injection Attacks on LLMs
items.summary: Collaborative research introduces inductive backdoors where LLMs learn malicious behaviors through generalization, and MINJA attacks that inject malicious records via query-only interactions.

items.title: MIT Develops Deep-Learning Model for Predicting Cell Behavior in Embryos
items.summary: Researchers created a model that forecasts cell movement, folding, and division in fruit fly embryos with 90% accuracy, with plans to apply to human tissues and diseases.

items.title: MIT AI Robotic System Builds Objects from Text Descriptions
items.summary: An AI-driven robot translates text prompts into 3D designs and assembles multi-component objects like chairs from prefabricated parts, making physical design more accessible.

items.title: Meta Rolls Out AI Audio Mode for Smart Glasses
items.summary: Meta's AI glasses update adds real-time audio processing to amplify a speaker's voice in noisy environments by filtering surrounding sounds.

items.title: AI Chatbots Driving Rising Energy Costs in US
items.summary: Energy costs are soaring partly due to AI demands, prompting efforts to modernize US energy infrastructure.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Samsung announces XNOS 2600, claims world's first 2nm mobile chip
items.summary: Samsung unveiled the XNOS 2600, which the company says is the first two‑nanometer mobile SoC and promises major performance, graphics, and on‑device processing gains.

items.title: Airbus explores moving critical systems to a European 'sovereign' cloud
items.summary: Airbus is preparing to tender contracts to migrate mission‑critical workloads away from U.S. hyperscalers toward a digitally sovereign European cloud to keep sensitive aerospace data under European control amid concerns about the U.S. Cloud Act.

items.title: Engadget review highlights 2025 tech setbacks including Xbox struggles
items.summary: A year‑end analysis outlines major tech disappointments in 2025 — from challenges in AI deployments to Xbox hardware and market struggles and ongoing controversies around drone maker DJI.

items.title: Artemis II crew and teams run full launch countdown rehearsal
items.summary: NASA and crew members conducted a launch day rehearsal (CDDT) for Artemis II with the integrated rocket, including an egress demonstration and flight termination system testing as part of final preparations.

items.title: Recap pieces: Tech industry failures and notable 2025 'trainwrecks' compiled
items.summary: Editorial roundups are cataloguing 2025's biggest tech missteps — from public demos and product flops to high‑profile corporate gaffes — as the year closes out.
